title: Bug 102436 - Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description: An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format) should have been rejected.
OB: When a 'DateTime' type report parameter is created in the BIRT report designer, if an invalid date string (e.g., '55/66/9999') is entered in the 'default value' field, the invalid value is accepted. The report design then shows the following parameter definition: <parameters><scalar parameter name='dateParam1'><property name='dataType'>dateTime</property><property name='allowBlank'>false</property><property name='format'>Unformatted</property><property name='controlType'>textbox</property><expression name='defaultValue'>55/66/9999</expression></scalar parameter></parameters>. There are two problems here:
EB: The model should reject an invalid date/time string and display an error message to the user. Additionally, if a valid date/time string is accepted, the model should store it using the XML schema date/time format (yyyymmddThh:mm:ss, as defined in the XML Schema specification) to ensure portability.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Open the BIRT report designer.
2. Create a new 'DateTime' type report parameter.
3. In the 'default value' field, enter an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999'.
4. Verify that the invalid value is accepted and saved in the report design.
